comment.text: 121 has a memory leak bug (at least when using it with Chromedriver/Selenium) which breaks our CI, 122 fixes this bug and our CI works correctly again

bugs.title: x86_64 user agent in arm platform

bugzilla.short_desc: x86_64 user agent in arm platform

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
In aarch64 platform, chromium sent x86_64 user agent ID
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/121.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

it will miss lead some web site.

Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
chromium-121.0.6167.160-1.el8.aarch64

early version maybe have the same problem.

How reproducible:
access http://whatmyuseragent.com in aarch64 platform.

Actual results:

Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/121.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

Expected results:

Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux aarch64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/121.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

Additional info:
the same chromium in epel9 is OK.

Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/122.0.0.0 Safari/537.36
chromium-122.0.6261.69-1.el8.aarch64 has the same user agent ID.
it is not yet fixed in chromium-122.0.6261.69-1, but in next build

this issue is fixed in chromium-122.0.6261.94-1.el8, could you please test and grant karma?

Thanks!

https://issues.chromium.org/issues/324596281
